intro: Fimbristylis nigritana, commonly known as black-haired sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typically found in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in wet or marshy environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Fimbristylis nigritana plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
